Description: Offset rim and shoulder sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery kylix; interior: on rim, band at edge; outlined alternate red and black tongues (much worn); traces of black band on inside of shoulder; exterior: on rim, incised cable pattern (only two rows of black dots remaining) between bands; traces of unidentified motif on shoulder.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1924,1201.1205 and belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1924,1201.1206,1924,1201.1207,1924,1201.1208, 1924,1201.1209 and 1924,1201.1224. For a similar cable pattern, see Newhall Stillwell, A. and Benson, J. L., Corinth: Results of Excavations Conducted by the American School of Classical Studies at Athens XV.3: The Potters Quarter - The Pottery. Princeton 1984, pl. 41 no. 886a and 903, both are late Corinthian.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.101) (Phase 1)
